Name of faculty: Science Department: Microbiology Unnamed: 0
                                              Program: B. Sc Microbiology Sem 2 Type: DSC-3        NaN
                                            Subject: Nutrition and Growth of Microorganisms        NaN
                                                        Credit: 04 Total learning hours: 60        NaN
     Course description: This subject provides knowledge about the nutritional requirements        NaN
of microorganisms and how those nutrients are transported inside the cell. Additionally, it        NaN
                   also inculcates the information about the growth pattern and measurement         of
    microorganisms, media used for various purposes along with their ingredients along with        NaN
          the methods and factors to be considered for culturing microbes in the laboratory        NaN
                                                                                conditions.        NaN
       Student learning outcome: This course makes the student thorough with the principles        NaN
       for growing microorganisms. After completion of this course, they can have knowledge        NaN
                                                                                        of:        NaN
                               Nutrients are required by different types of microorganism.        NaN
                                                            Principles of microbial growth        NaN
                                 How to prepare media and grow microbes in the laboratory.        NaN
                                                      Measurement of microbial population.        NaN

Name of faculty: Science Department: Microbiology Unnamed: 0
                                                           Program: B.Sc. Microbiology Sem 2 Type: DSC-4        NaN
                                                                             Subject:Microbial Diversity        NaN
                                                                     Credit: 04 Total learning hours: 60        NaN
                                                                                     Course description:        NaN
         This course offers majors information about remarkable environmental and metabolic diversity of        NaN
                  prokaryotic, eukaryotic microorganisms and some viruses. Major topics covering include        NaN
                information about microbial world, diversity of bacteria, mycology, phycology, virology,        NaN
                    protistology and some multicellular parasites. As various microbes thrive throughout        the
biosphere, this paper will define the limits of life and creating conditions contributing for the better        NaN
                                                             survival of other living forms in universe.        NaN
                                                                               Student learning outcome:        NaN
                 Students will expand knowledge about events of evolution and diverse group of microbes        NaN
                    Complete awareness about major group of organism including bacteria, fungi, algae ,        NaN
                                                                  protozoa, viruses, and some parasites.        NaN
              Expanded knowledge will be gain with respect to microbial cell structure and reproduction        NaN
                                                                                                systems.        NaN

Name of faculty: Science Department:Environmental\rScience
                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Program: B.Sc. Sem 2                       Type: DSE-2
                                                                                                                                                                                                            Subject: Microbial Ecology                               NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Credit: 04          Total learning hours: 60
Student learning outcome:\rHaving basic knowledge of microbial ecology and its fundamental concepts.\rUnderstanding dynamics and interactions of microbial communities.\rUnderstanding of microbial association with higher plants.                               NaN
